title: Are there any famous intellectuals who experimented with LSD? - Quora

response.answer_text: A quite famous case is DNA structure co-discoverer Francis Crick. The claims that he was on LSD when he did important discoveries on DNA structure are almost certainly false, but there is little doubt he did use LSD later in his life. Maybe Richard Feynman. He was interested but also reluctant, and the other elements are not clear. If you would consider them “intellectuals,” both Bill Gates and Steve Jobs have confessed doing LSD in their youth in public interviews.

This guy:  Kary Mullis, who won a Nobel prize for discovering the Polymerase Chain Reaction (still in use today and fundamental in the field of genetics) admitted to using (or rather abusing) several hallucinogenic compounds, which he designed and produced himself in order to stay ahead of regulation, which kept adding compounds to the list of forbidden substances. His book, dancing naked in the field of mind, is hilarious and awesome.
